basic_info.description: My name is Andrew, I'm a computer science student at Stony Brook University with an interest in Game Programming, Web Development, UI-Programming, and Low Level Programming.  I started my programming education in my late 20s, and recently have made the jump to full time school and will graduating Fall of 2023.  I currently am taking courses for a specialization in game programming, and have been a part of the Regio Vinco team at Stony Brook since the Fall of 2021.  Currently seeking Internships for the Summer of 2023.  Outside of school I love playing guitar, writing music, audio production and engineering, Muay Thai, and spending time with my family, friends, and my girlfriend.

projects.title: Regio Vinco
projects.description: Geographic Browser Based Game meant to both teach and test player in various geographic trivia.  As the Gameplay and UI programmer for the project, I have updated the UI to be easier to follow, added two new game modes for teaching and training newer players, and fixing formatting issues and game bugs

projects.title: 2D Convex Hull Algorithms Demos
projects.description: Demonstrates 5 different algorithms involving convex hulls, specifically, Quick Hull, Point in Convex Hull, Minkowski Sum, Minkowski Difference, and GJK.  Users can click on five different buttons assigned to each algorithm in order to try each demo, and can move around various points with each demo to change the shape of the convex hulls and the outcome of the algorithms.

projects.title: 3D Sphere Collision Simulator
projects.description: Simulation of 3D spheres moving and colliding inside a cube. User can generate up to 10 spheres of different masses and velocities, and can toggle on and off color, textures, materials, shadow and gravity. Where sphere's collide with one another, they will change size, material, and textures.  User can also move the camera through the scene, and move the light source as well

projects.title: McBendorjee Vs. Robots
projects.description: Original Top Down Action-Puzzle Game where a college professor is trapped inside his own video game.  Created with a three person team for a 2D game development class, my primary roles were lead designer, gameplay programmer, and composer. The game was made with a custom 2D engine made by students that uses Typescript with HTML canvas to render the game to the browser.

projects.title: Top-5-Lister
projects.description: Website developed for a school project that allows users to create their top 5 lists of various categories.  Each list a user creates can be viewed by other users, where they can like, dislike, and comment.  Top 5 lists of the same name will consolidate and create community lists, where each individual user's lists count as a vote for a specific item in the list, and the items with most votes will appear in the community top 5 list
